recipe.ingredients: - dry lentils: 1 cup - water: 4 cups - diced tomatoes (no salt added): 1 can (14.5 ounces) - carrot (chopped): 1 large - celery stalk (chopped): 2 - onion (chopped): 1 medium - garlic (minced): 3 cloves - bay leaves: 2 - dried thyme: 1 teaspoon - dried rosemary: 1/2 teaspoon - fresh spinach leaves: 2 cups - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - black pepper: to taste
recipe.directions: 1. Rinse Lentils: Thoroughly rinse the lentils under cold water. 2. Saut√© Vegetables: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, carrots, celery, and minced garlic. Cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes. 3. Cook Stew: Add lentils, water, diced tomatoes, bay leaves, thyme, and rosemary to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for about 30 minutes or until lentils are tender. 4. Add Greens: Stir in the fresh spinach leaves and continue to simmer for an additional 5 minutes. 5. Season and Serve: Remove bay leaves, season with black pepper to taste, and serve warm.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 40g, Dietary Fiber: 18g, Sodium: 70mg, Saturated Fat: 0.5g, Total Fat: 3g, Protein: 12g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 4g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe: Approximately 494 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Lentils: 230 calories for 1 cup (dry) Diced Tomatoes: 41 calories per can Carrot: 25 calories Celery: 6 calories for 2 stalks Onion: 44 calories Garlic: 13 calories Spinach: 14 calories for 2 cups Olive Oil: 120 calories for 1 tablespoon Bay Leaves, Thyme, Rosemary, Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 4
